website_summaries.verdict: Tonka’s durable and award-winning “Power Movers” Excavator will captivate little construction workers with its true-to-life motions and sounds.
pros: Makes realistic engine, hydraulic, and beeping sounds as the excavator moves
Easy to control the arm and bucket
cons: A little on the noisy side

customer_reviews.title: Garbage quality! Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for my 4 yr olds birthday from a local store as a last minute gift. Sound didnt work, replacing batteries didnt help. So figured it had been played with to much on the shelf. Decided to order one from amazon. Same problem. This is a Hasbro problem. They have really came down in quality. Their toys are cheaply made. And they do not care about customer opinions. I recommend going with a different brand. Even if it's a few extra bucks. Quality matters. It will be worth it. Now I have a super sad 4 yr old. Shame on Hasbro.
customer_reviews.author: Tressie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible quality! It’s such a cool toy and concept. I have two other power movers; the dump truck and cement mixing truck both are pretty decent with the exception of the hub caps constantly coming off. But this excavator is terrible the rubber tracks constantly come off and hardly ever get enough traction to roll on any surface. The bucket arm handle can barely handle a small amount of sand it doesn’t move with sand in it feels like the little handle is going to break off. I feel better materials should’ve been used here. It’s sad because Tonka used to be known for great quality toys.
customer_reviews.author: M-Rod

customer_reviews.title: Plastic garbage!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is very flimsy, not like the Tonka quality that we are used to. The toy is very loud and obnoxious, and tire tracks don't move on carpet at all. What a piece of garbage. I am glad we tested it out before gifting it to our son on Christmas. Returning it for a full refund. We will look at Bruder instead. Their toys at least still represent quality.
customer_reviews.author: L.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great trucks
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a medium size set of tractors and i wated tonka brand. Thisset consists of three trucks andvthen i found a bulldozer sold separately, and ordered that too. My 2 1/2 year old grandson loves them. They have great sounds and a good size forhis sandbox
customer_reviews.author: silly

customer_reviews.title: Track will not roll.  Poor design
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my Son, He loves it. I am very disappointed that the tracks are of poor design and do not roll well on the floor when pushing. This could have been a very good review for many reasons but i guess we just have a bad one. This is a cool toy and i really liked the price but knowing what i know now I would have just spent more money on a nicer toy excavator. The worst thing is that the tracks roll fine when you spin them by hand. As soon as you try and roll it on the floor (marble,tile,area rug, hardwood) no matter the surface it doesn't roll.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Cheap...
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap. My 2 year old managed to break it already after a month.... Tonka just doesn’t make them like they used to :( too late to return it ... I’ll try some gorilla glue.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Diauto

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing -
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our two year old son for Christmas. The tracks never worked and after maybe two hours of play and new batteries the noise stopped working completely. We are so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: A girl

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t move can’t really do anything. Not too sure on the product design here but the tracks are very hard to move and the claw lifts but is still kind of awkward to maneuver. I can’t image a riddle or young child trying to work this. My son loves it but doesn’t really play with it like his other trucks. I got it because it was the closest to a toy excavator I could find but regret it. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Frank and Iris

customer_reviews.title: Ouch! Pinch points!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yea just like the real thing! Pinch Points!!! My kids fingers fit in the gaps where the shovel arm articulates so when he picks it up the weight of the toy pulls that gap closed and his finger gets squeezed! He still sleeps with it in bed though... oh well. He hasn't seemed to make the same mistake twice, so I guess we're keeping it on the "job site".
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: No Power Components  Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: This has no power component or any moving parts. It is made cheaply with plastic and does not inspire any creative play for the grandkids. Tonka used to be known as a brand based on quality metal and creative play toys. Not anymore. Cheap plastic knock offs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lavelle

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be re-engineered
customer_reviews.text: Sound stopped within the first 5 minutes. Internal wiring ripped out of the speaker. Tracks don’t move when pushed and tracks roll off the nearly nonexistent guides when they do move
customer_reviews.author: John Viars

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old and 4 year old boys broke this within a week..... didnt think it was possible. Wires everywhere and now it is trash👎
customer_reviews.author: Heather Smith

customer_reviews.title: Typical Tonka.
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves it. Pushed it all over. It makes a truck noise but not too loud so that it’s annoying. Nice ....
customer_reviews.author: Mary E.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, the toy will not last long with our 4 year old. The sound it great but the handle to lift and turn the bucket move minimally.
customer_reviews.author: goobergirl83

customer_reviews.title: Hard th o move
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this item for my nephew I thought it was a great gift. When I recieved the item I was like wow it looks great. Once I saw my nephew playing with the truck he was having a hard time. It's TRUE it's really hard to move the truck. If you need to move the difference pieces you have to do it manually. Also, the cavader belt that move the truck it's really hard. I don't think this toy is good for a young child and I won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Oquendo

customer_reviews.title: Sound feature doesn’t work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: the track that controls the sound doesn’t move on any surface, with any amount of pressure - so the sound feature of its movement is pretty worthless. The quality is okay - thick plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Halloween King

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Electronics are junk.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 3 year old for Christmas and after a week the sound stopped working. Yes we swapped the batteries ;) I ordered a replacement and the new one doesn’t have sound out of the box even with fresh batteries. Not sure I even want to go through the hassle of trying to return it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike E.

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if it worked correctly
customer_reviews.text: Liked the toy and so did the kid but the issue with the toy is that only one track controls the sound effects. When you push the toy forward the track gets misaligned and then does not make the reving noises it is supposed to so you can realign it and push it about 2 inches and it does the same thing. This is not an issue if you are pushing it in reverse and no other issues with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: brandon lutze

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Considering this was a name-brand Tonka toy, I was expecting better quality. The lights worked when activating the button however there were no noises made as described on the packaging for the motor going forward and the beeping going backwards. I paid extra for this toy versus others to have some interactive features. My three-year-old grandson happy to get it but not thinking he will play with it much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste time or money.  Toy is defective
customer_reviews.text: This toy is the worst. Its deceiving. Looks good but tracks do not roll well. Most irritating is that the sound button stopped working about 10 minutes after we opened it for his 4th birthday. My son was so excited when he opened it and now just disappointed. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Carter

customer_reviews.title: SUCH A DISAPPOINTMENT!!
customer_reviews.text: Excavators are my son’s favorite but this toy has him wanting to play with anything but this... the tracks refuse to roll. I wish I would have read the reviews before purchasing. Very disappointing considering this is a Tonka. Don’t waste your money, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Ashley Ford

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it, only slight issues
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy, and overall I think it is a good value and good quality. The only issue that we have is the belt comes off the wheels making it difficult to push forwards and backwards to activate the noises.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality junk
customer_reviews.text: This is not the Tonka I grew up with. My kids played with this for about an hour before it broke in half. Some of the other reviews show similar results... expected higher quality from a brand I grew up on. One star is being generous here...
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Electronics stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The electronics stopped working after 3 days. Went through 2 sets of batteries in 3 days and then it just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R.

customer_reviews.title: Lever to move bucket broke
customer_reviews.text: The lever (or "T-handle") that moves the bucket broke the first time it was used to move some play sand. Might just be our bad luck rather than a problem with all of these. A dump truck and front loader was purchased at the same time and they have been fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Cavaleri

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. Tracks won’t roll so it doesn’t make any of the noises.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy sykes

customer_reviews.title: The Face of my Son Smile Value a Million
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Happy My Son its Happy The Excavator Is Awesome Strong And Easy to Play with it
customer_reviews.author: JoeAlvaS

customer_reviews.title: Newer style Tonka
customer_reviews.text: Grew up with the steel Tonka toys. Appears to be durable and has sound.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance L Hays

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Way smaller than expected lights and sound broke within a week was not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Vanourney

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy for rough toddler
customer_reviews.text: 2 year old is obsessed with excavators. Tracks do fall off fairly easy but that’s the only negative so far. Very sturdy for hard play.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not the best or worse
customer_reviews.text: Very loud sound effects which my kid loves. It's hard to push around because of the tracks. You have to push it down to get it going so I'm not sure how long it will last because of that. Overall descent toy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Larrisa G.

customer_reviews.title: Tracks
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 3 year old , only down fall was the tracks fall off often
customer_reviews.author: andrea Brenz

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. I was not expecting this from Tonka.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! piece of junk DON'T BUY IT! I was not expecting this of Tonka. Tracks don't move! doesn't matter the surface... Hardwood, carpet... nothing! I am so disappointed that I threw original box away...
customer_reviews.author: Nara Costa

customer_reviews.title: Great toy excavator!
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these for my grandsons. They love 'um!
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Realistic!
customer_reviews.text: My child loves playing with this. It functions and makes sounds just as a real excavator.
customer_reviews.author: VFKnights

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It broke within few days after we bought. First the wheel doesn't work and top part fell off after my son drop it once. It's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Loud, realistic, and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 year old loves it. And sleeps with it. lol. It is pretty heavy duty. The sound of the engine seems realistic and is loud.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves it. The item was very sturdy and seems to be of good material. My son is quite fond of it and plays very rough with it, but it holds up. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, short sound life
customer_reviews.text: This toy was my 2 year old sons absolute favorite. Sadly the sounds stopped working and batteries being replaced did not fix it. Returning for replacement. Hope it was bad luck.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rapson

customer_reviews.title: Cute truck but the sounds don’t work
customer_reviews.text: The toy is exactly what my son was looking for. The only downside is that the sound on it only worked for a day, even when we replace the batteries. It’s good for digging in the dirt but the additional functions don’t work.
customer_reviews.author: DistrictDiva

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Kinda of cheap, but my son has still had fun with it. Overall not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MrsCashatt

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: It did not like the sandbox and was broken later the same day it was given to a 6 year old. Tonka is not the same quality it once was! Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: James A Stonerock

customer_reviews.title: Product not as featured in video
customer_reviews.text: This Tonka Excavator does not work the same as the video displayed on Amazon. The crane does not go straight up and the arm collapses immediately. It does not push very well when you push it.
customer_reviews.author: dana cochran

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves all trucks. This was a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Toy
customer_reviews.text: We have given this as a gift to my friend's kid and he likes it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Ayan Chakraborty

customer_reviews.title: Tonka toys are tuff
customer_reviews.text: Grand baby is real hard on toys. So I buy the tuffest I can. Tonka never lets me down they are the only toys that can stand up to him
customer_reviews.author: carey a sontag

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: The treads constantly came off when rolling so I removed them completely. Everything else is fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tonka Tough
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s a great toy for the price. Certainly holds up to my toddlers abuse 😂
customer_reviews.author: Milan Rudanovic

customer_reviews.title: No sound even with new batteries
customer_reviews.text: Product died after the first use. No sound. New batteries and all.
customer_reviews.author: Sonic

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was not impressed the tracks fall off real easy it feels poorly made not as good as the metal line of tonka trucks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not terrible
customer_reviews.text: Decent toy. Very difficult to push forward and backwards for the sound effects to be triggered
customer_reviews.author: Carney

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was told that this was all metal even the bucket. It is NOT. Alot of parts are a hard plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Marilynn Shady

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but tought to roll
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built toy that makes realistic sounds and is fun to play with. Unfortunately, the tracks don't roll easily.
customer_reviews.author: Robert O Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Hard to push
customer_reviews.text: This is very hard to push forward or back and have the tracks move.
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: This truck takes batteries I just don't know what for because it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Made of plastic
customer_reviews.text: Everything is plastic, not sure how long it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Terri D.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Broke in less than a month. My kids were not rough with it at all and it just fell apart
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend for buying
customer_reviews.text: Tracks are not rollable. Hard to move. My kid was disappointed. Never buy
customer_reviews.author: Chatcja

customer_reviews.title: Sound breaks immediately.
customer_reviews.text: The sound immediately broke. The treads don't stay in and get jammed.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Can't even push the toy no guide rollers on the tracks to help it move piss poor design
customer_reviews.author: Logan Douglass

product_meta.title: Tonka 8047 Power Movers Excavator Toy Vehicle, Yellow
product_meta.description: With Tonka power movers, you take control! this rugged excavator features new motion drive technology allowing for fun and intuitive play that brings the action to life! with motion drive technology, push the vehicle forward to make the engine rev and activate the lights; push the vehicle backward to hear back-up sounds; work the arm and bucket to hear hydraulic sounds and flash the lights. The features activated by the child's interaction with the vehicle create an engaging and realistic, Tonka tough experience every time they play. Appropriate for ages 3 years and up. Batteries included. Collect them all!.
feature_bullets: 12 inch Tonka excavator with lights & sounds
Move the truck forward for flashing lights and engine revving sound
Move the truck backwards for back up “beep-beep” sounds
Work the arm and bucket for hydraulic sounds.
Appropriate for ages 3 years and up. Batteries included.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars380 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
